author: Staff Reporter
text:
Two years after the murder of a Tasmac salesman, Serious Crime Squad, formed by rural police to probe serious crime cases arrested two persons for committing the crime. M. Kumar (37) of Chinna Seeragapadi, working as a salesman at a Tasmac outlet in Mallur, was attacked by unidentified persons on April 5, 2014.

He was admitted to Government Mohan Kumaramangalam Medical College Hospital where he died the next day. SP G. Subbulakshmi recently transferred the case to Serious Crime Squad.

On February 8, the squad members, who were on a vehicle check on Attayampatty-Ariyanoor Road, stopped a two-wheeler. On enquiry, they found that the riders, T. Gunasekaran (25) and S. Dinesh (28), both of Attayampatty, murdered Kumar and took away Rs. 20,000.
title: Murder accused held after 2 years
